txt.en:
'Ar, [placeholder]. You can find a way to carry something back to me, I'm certain. It's a little task, hardly worth mention, I will admit, but then again so is feeding a bunch of thankless maggots like you!

'The rat-folk in the south grow a strange leaf. The leaf tastes terrible and more often than not the rat-folk burn it after drying it out, strange little blighters. But the seeds can be ground up and used as a fairly tasty addition to gruel.

'If you can gather up a bundle of the seeds, I would be very grateful.'
'These will do nicely and make the gruel taste more bland and less terrible!'
'The seeds can be found on the rat-folk, though more frequently in their fields or even in the areas of the woods nearby.'
A Dash of This and That

Taskmaster Gukthor admits hating the taste of gruel, but has found that the seeds the rat-folk use to grow their leaf adds a nice bite to the mash he uses in his gruel. He has asked that you collect ten seeds for the evening meal.
Return to Taskmaster Gukthor at Dâr-gazag
The rat-folk living south of Dâr-gazag along the river grow a plant that can be crushed to make a tasty spice.\n\nTaskmaster Gukthor waits for you to return with the brittle-leaf seeds.
